title: [DJ SONA] DJ Sona causes all music to disappear.
body:
Since buying DJ Sona, I have not had any music in any of my matches, including games using DJ Sona. Is it something that happened with the patch? Maybe all the sound files magically disappeared? Will I just have to completely delete and re-download the client?

{{item:3070}} {{champion:37}} {{item:3070}}

replies.body:
Hey Kyohi,

This may sound silly, but do you have your in-game music turned up? DJ Sona's music is connected to the in-game music. Therefore, if you normally have it turned off because you're listening to Pandora, for instance, you wouldn't hear the DJ Sona music.

What about the people, such as myself, who have been unable to hear DJ Sona's music at all in game? This is an issue many people have been dealing with. I've been going into game every day to check to see if its resolved and I've done everything I can on my end to change it, but the music never plays.

Would you mind attaching a copy of your DX Diag and a copy of a r3dlog from a game where you were DJ Sona?

**To find your r3dlog:**  Each file appears like this: [yyyy-mm-ddT15-40-03] _r3dlog.txt, where yyyy-mm-dd is the date of the match played. You can find them here: C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\Logs\Game - R3d Logs

**To grab a DX Diag:** 
1. Press [Windows Key]
2. Type dxdiag in the search bar and hit 'Ok'
3. The DirectX Diagnostic Tool will open. Press the "Save All Information..." button.
4. Choose where to save the file (for example, your desktop).
5. Attach the DxDiag to your response on the forums or support ticket.

I played more than one game that day but I believe this is the r3dlog file in question. I am not sure if I should post it here or not. As for the dxdiag file, I'm trying to save it but it is currently stuck at 50% when I try to do so. Would the R3d logs be enough? Should I post them here or in another thread?
If you open the r3dlog, and ctrl+ F and search for "Sona", it'll let you know if you had a Sona in your game. Let's start with r3dlogs. :] You can post them here.

Then I certainly have one of them from this past Saturday, February 28. I apologize if this is too long to post here.

Would you mind attaching this as a .txt file in a post? It doesn't look like the entire log posted.
Alright, I attached it here. I selected all the text in this particular game and copied it into another text file.

Thanks! 

So, after taking a quick look at your log, I'm seeing that some sound files aren't loading because they can't be found.

I would suggest trying a system repair (it may take a while, but it should repair any missing/corrupted files). 

Give that a shot, and if you're still having issues, please let me know!

For the moment that has worked. Unfortunately....ALL of my item lists are gone.

Sighs tiredly.

Gah, sorry about your item lists. D: 

I'm glad to see your sound is working, at least.
I've given up on making item lists because they get deleted so frequently. It happens a lot. :(
Lucky that you can still play the game though ;;
Sorry dude. I hope it works for you.

Idk. I'll probably have to do a fresh install of the client, which I don't want to do, so I'll be back on league in maybe a few months... Two days of this and I'm just tired of it. Have fun though, man. Glad some people are getting through!

I would advise against that. I figured that I was missing sound files and attempted to system repair. Needless to say I can't even get past the launch screen anymore. My client is completely broken now.
Should I do this as well, if my client ever starts working again?
Yes, please!

Yes, I've checked all of my in-game settings through multiple test games and regular games. Not once has my music played. Even lowering all other sounds to 0 and leaving music at 100, I will not get any music to play this patch. That is where I got the idea that my sound files glitched out while patching. I took the liberty of attempting to use the repair tool on client, and now I can't patch (I get the unable to fully patch error) and now I can not play at all. Though Nimir stated it in a rather brash in tone, I have also done what I could on my end to attempt to fix the problem, but nothing has worked. I've seen threads about this before, but all of them have either been buried or are no longer there... Which is why I took the liberty of creating another. I just hope this could be solved sooner rather than later. Thank you for your hard work and for the response!

I appreciate you bringing this up, as it seems like you're not the only one. Would you mind doing what I'd suggested for Nimir Rah - attaching your DX Diag and r3dlogs. We may be able to find out what the issue is based on that. 

Player Support may also have some ideas on what the issue may be here. (I'm on the skins team, but my troubleshooting knowledge is pretty limited. D:

If you're unable to get a fix via re-installing (hopefully you're able to do so), I would suggest [submitting a ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new?ticket_form_id=4584) to Player Support, and they'd be able to give you a few more troubleshooting options.

I have, however, had a few players say that a re-install fixed their sound issues with DJ Sona.

I would, but my client still won't work. I'll go through the Player Support process, I suppose, since I have no other options right now... 

Error Message, for reference: http://prntscr.com/6c1kkk
Sorry I couldn't be of more help. D:
It's fine. However, support told me to go in game when I can't even get past the launch screen... I'll keep trying to get help from them, I suppose. :l

" Will I just have to completely delete and re-download the client?"
I not League Technical Support,  but I doubt that would be a fix.  Try looking up how to use the game's repair option.
Tried this, and now the client is failing to re-patch at all constantly. Gone through the process multiple times already. Now I can't even play.
Is the background music sound on? Prior to DJ Sona I had that thing muted since day one... no offense to the music team. Her song isn't ambient sound effects or voice.

No.

Edit: "No" as in no, I always have music on, so that isn't the problem.
